Message.Title: FMH on Dividends BAcompared AB and actual money and rolled in stock gains on a 200K investmnet
Message.Msg: This is what a 200k investment dividend , year to date would pay you for Boeing it would be $3341 US dollars , for Airbus after taxes it would be $2616. International takeout taxes first. (15%) For a period of one year from today going back 1 year without dividend included in stock price gain Airbus is up 60%, Boeing is up 41% . With dividend reinvested Boeing stock price would have gained 43%, Airbus stock price gain with dividend reinvestment is 62% both companies , the duopoly, know what each other does so that dividend is not significant. So unless you want to live on $3341 off 200k from Boeing or $2616 year to date dividends then the only factor ina investment choice is stock price gain. Airbus betters Boeing over the 5 year period at a stock price gain of 172.91% that means each dollar invested in Airbus has made you $1.73 for Boeing you worse off , only made 60.82%. Airbus is executing better than Boeing they are number 1 and will be as long as the A350 delivers and Airbus knows that. FMH did a correct dividend analysis . I just put it into dollars and percentage , so investors might understand the number . Here is foulmouthharbors statement "So airbus has paid investors a total of 1.49/ share since 2009. Assuming it is listed in Euros, it equals 1.98/share in USD. BA has paid investors $8.25 in USD since 2009 and has at least one more divvy ($.485) before year end (20130.

Message.Title: Oiliver Stone: “Obama is a snake,” .....“He’s a snake. And we have to turn on him.
Message.Msg: Oliver Stone: “Obama is a snake,” he told reporters earlier this week at the Foreign Correspondents' Club of Japan, eliciting laughter and applause. “He’s a snake. And we have to turn on him. “It’s never about terrorists, it always becomes about the way J. Edgar Hoover did it,” he said. “He brought all the weight of government to bear against protestors. He didn’t like protestors. He thought they were left-wing communists. He never could find the proof, but by the time the Vietnam War came around, as you know, 500,000 people were on the list, and they were being eavesdropped on. And where are we now? Same place.” Mr. Stone also praised whistleblower Edward Snowden, calling him a personal hero. “He sacrificed his well-being for the good of us all,” he said. “I think [Russian President Vladimir] Putin did the right thing, and I’m proud of him for doing it. We need more countries to stand up to the U.S.”

Message.Title: Will Obama be the Last Black President for a 100 years?
Message.Msg: Most everyone wanted to believe we were post racial and that a black man could serve as our president. The problem is one of competency. Obama is not competent, has no economic experience or knowledge, is bigoted and is governing somewhat like a restrained Robert Mugabe with similar results. There were far, far more qualified Black men than Obama.....men who had actually accomplished things......men like Allen West, Charles Payne, Thomas Sowell, Clarence Thomas and Senator Tim Scott. But the one chosen was a snake oil salesman, a con artist with a sliver tongue. He would chant things like hope and change and no one would ever ask "hope for what", or "change to what." He would say things like "we are 5 days away from fundamentally transforming America.” No one would ask “fundamentally transforming from what to what?” The results have been an economy in shambles, tremendous job losses, high energy costs, massive debt, abuses of government power over citizens, nepotism and cronyism. The most vulnerable, especially blacks have suffered and the middle class has been decimated. Desperate people have turned to welfare, food stamps and disability benefits in record numbers. Even black people are catching on and realizing they have not benefited under his administration. Democrats and liberals don’t dare admit their tremendous mistake or they would never be re-reelected again and are therefore forced to continue lying and mounting rigorous defenses about the non-existent successes of this administration. These are people that are devoted to their party more than they are to their country and the ideals upon which this country was founded. They are the true bigots and have set race relations and the hope of black people back a 100 years.

Message.Title: Obama's Economic Approval Plunges to 35%...
Message.Msg: PRINCETON, NJ -- Despite President Barack Obama's renewed focus on the nation's economy this summer, he scores worse with Americans on the economy than he did in June. His approval rating on the issue, now 35%, is down seven percentage points, and his ratings on taxes and the federal budget deficit are each down five points. During the same period, his overall approval rating is down three points.

Message.Title: Woman with concealed-carry permit breaks up robbery...
Message.Msg: HOUSTON - A woman opened fire on a group of robbers at a local Denny's restaurant. At around 4 a.m. Thursday, a man who does not want to be identified, said his brother was robbed by six men with guns at a Denny's off the Gulf Freeway in southeast Houston. "I don't know if it was random or someone set him up. Because he got his own label," said the victim's brother. His brother's wife was in the restroom at the time, but when she exited the restroom she saw the group of suspected robbers. Police said that's when she pulled out her gun and shot at them. "She said she came out of the restroom and saw my brother on the floor. That's when she started doing what she gotta do. She got a license and she'll do anything to protect her kids and my brother," he said. Police said there was a shootout, but it is not known how many shots were fired at the time. However, police said the gunshots did hit cars in the parking lot. No bystanders or customers were injured. The group of suspects fled the scene. The married couple said they are still shook up, but their family said they're glad they made it out alive. "Self-defense saved my brother's life," he said. According to police, the robbers got away with jewelry. If you have any information that could lead to an arrest call Crime Stoppers at (713)-222-TIPS.

Topic.Title: 787 issues

Message.Msg: QC ? QC? we dont need no stinking QC !-- We outsource QC to the vendors and subs, we reduce the folks who do/did vendor evaluations and monitoring. We save a few bucks up front. If a problem appears, its NOT out of our budget. Source Inspection and review ? Thats an outdated concept. We are not responsible for the vendor who must translate oor specs into east swahili to build to the parts we describe in clear pig latin. And for those who complain- dont let the doorknob hit you . . . we can hire your replacement at 1/3 the cost. The power point rangers have proved it will save a few milions per year- which can be added to the executive pensions and free healthcare. If the flight computer goes blue screen- it takes 2 hours to reboot- we learned that from Micro- squish So what is yiour complaint about QC?

Message.Title: German man who could have been a rodeo clown was imprisoned in 1938 for talking freely
Message.Msg: Hoodz_wiener suggested in an earlier comment that a rodeo clown might not deserve the right to free speech. Such thinking sounded vaguely familiar so I did some research and found this. AUSTRIAN IMPRISONED Vienna, Dec. 28, 1938 Albert Schoenhart, of Klagenfurt, has been sentenced to six months' imprisonment on a charge of reckless talking. It was alleged that he abused the Feu'hrer and declared that in two years' time Germany would disappear from the map. The accused pleaded that he had had too much drink after a mountaineering trip and did not remember the conversation.

Message.Title: which is better Airbus stock gains over 51% yeaer to date or boeing 36% and How about dividends
Message.Msg: for 5 years rolling dividends inot both stocks the answer Airbus is up 268% as of yesterday ,Boeing on reinvested dividends for 5 year up 163%. Airbus is not considering increasing their dividend payout substantially , if done that comparison will swing much more toward Airbus and now for a year to date comparison with dividends for the barker boys This is what a 200k investment dividend , year to date would pay you for Boeing it would be $3341 US dollars , for Airbus after taxes it would be $2616. International takeout taxes first. (15%) For a period of one year from today going back 1 year without dividend included in stock price gain Airbus is up 60%, Boeing is up 41% . With dividend reinvested Boeing stock price would have gained 43%, Airbus stock price gain with dividend reinvestment is 62% both companies , the duopoly, know what each other does so that dividend is not significant. So unless you want to live on $3341 off 200k from Boeing or $2616 year to date dividends then the only factor ina investment choice is stock price gain. Airbus betters Boeing over the 5 year period at a stock price gain of 172.91% that means each dollar invested in Airbus has made you $1.73 for Boeing you worse off , only made 60.82%. Airbus is executing better than Boeing they are number 1 and will be as long as the A350 delivers and Airbus knows that. FMH did a correct dividend analysis . I just put it into dollars and percentage , so investors might understand the number . Here is foulmouthharbors statement "So airbus has paid investors a total of 1.49/ share since 2009. Assuming it is listed in Euros, it equals 1.98/share in USD. BA has paid investors $8.25 in USD since 2009 and has at least one more divvy ($.485) before year end (20130. Less

Topic.Title: Which is better, Joseph Goebbels or Wayne Dickley?

Message.Msg: Protecting your rights - August 22, 2012 Boeing violates labor law during orientation SPEEA filed Unfair Labor Practice (ULP) charges against The Boeing Company on Tuesday (Aug. 21) after a representative from Boeing Ethics, during new hire orientation on Friday (Aug. 17), told employees they are prohibited from saying “bad things” about their employment. Such discussions by union members are protected by the National Labor Relation Act (NLRA). Employers’ efforts to curb these discussions violate federal law. In addition to this obvious violation of labor law, SPEEA has received numerous complaints from employees about managers telling them to remove and not display union material at their personal workstation. Employees also report finding union-related items removed from individual work areas when they arrive at work each day. SPEEA asks members to document any such conversations with managers or the removal of items from their desks and then relay the information to union officials. Report questionable conversations with managers or when they find union material removed from work areas. ++++ yep wayne- grab your socks and tell us the result

Topic.Title: What does the Bible say about homosexuality?

Message.Msg: juanruiz, "As for Saul of Tarsus, it he had had his way there would be no second generation of Christians." First, I am not sure what you mean by "second generation of Christians". And, second, given that the Apostle Paul wrote half of the New Testament, his demonstrated path and purpose at his conversion, even unto his death, was to spread the Gospel and further the cause of Christ - i.e., to reach out and save the world. I am not sure what you might be referring to relative to Paul trying to prevent the advent of succeeding generations of Christians. BB

Topic.Title: What does the Bible say about homosexuality?

Message.Msg: Paul recommended celibacy for all, and essentially brags that since all are not as strong as he, marriage is the next best thing. As I said, if all his followers had followed his advice, there would be no children. As for writing half the NT, I believe that's a bit of hyperbole.
